meanings.definition: A person who lavishes praise, especially insincerely.
meanings.sent1: The flatterer always said nice things to get what they wanted.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a flatterer when he complimented her non-stop.
meanings.sent3: The flatterer's words were as sweet as candy, but just as empty.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the flatterer's honeyed words, for they may hide deceit.
meanings.sent5: The flatterer's praise was like a shiny but fake jewel, enticing yet worthless.

meanings.definition: To praise or compliment excessively and often insincerely.
meanings.sent1: He would flatterer his boss to try to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She didn't like when people would flatterer her just to get on her good side.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would flatterer the audience with jokes to win their favor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could flatterer even the grumpiest of customers into buying more.
meanings.sent5: The politician would flatterer the crowd with promises he never intended to keep.
